title: Sheriff use of force data (2017-2025) (Ross County Sheriff)

communications.subject: Ohio Open Records Law Request: Sheriff use of force data (2017-2025) (Ross County Sheriff)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Ohio Open Records Law, I hereby request the following records:

Use of force (UOF) data dating from January 1, 2017 to December 31, 2025. If possible, please provide this data in database or spreadsheet format and include the case number, incident date, incident time, subject injured indicator, subject injury force related info (e.g. Yes or No), subject age, subject gender, subject ethnicity, subject weapon type, incident area occurred, force type, officer division (e.g. law enforcement operations, detention/correctional operations, etc.), badge number and names associated with the officers involved. If one or more of these fields or dates is unavailable, provide all fields and/or information that is available responsive to my request. If no database or spreadsheet format is available, please provide copies of each individual use of force report or other report where use of force information is documented/reported by officers. Note, this is for all use of force incidents reported by your agency, not limited to only those incidents required to be reported under state or federal programs.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days.

Sincerely,

Samuel Sinyangwe

communications.subject: RE: Ohio Open Records Law Request: Sheriff use of force data (2017-2025) (Ross County Sheriff)
communications.communication:

Thank you,

communications.subject: FW: Virginia Freedom of Information Act Request: Sheriff use of force data (2017-2025) (Pittsylvania County Sheriff's Department (Virginia))
communications.communication:
Good morning, Mr. Nash,

We are in receipt of your FOIA request. Pittsylvania County encourages all requesters to submit FOIA requests directly through our FOIA portal, as this allows you to track the status of your request and receive updates electronically.

I have entered the request into the system on your behalf. You will receive an acknowledgement receipt. If you do not receive this notification, please contact me directly.

For future FOIA request, please visit the following link: https://pittsylvaniacountyva.nextrequest.com/.<https://pittsylvaniacountyva.nextrequest.com/> Or you may also access the portal on our website.

Best regards,
Heidi L. Jones
​​​​
Pittsylvania County Attorney's Office
Legal Assistant/FOIA Officer
Email:
Heidi.Jones@pittgov.org<mailto:Heidi.Jones@pittgov.org>
Tel:

communications.subject: Your Pittsylvania County, VA public records request #26-25 has been submitted.
communications.communication:
Pittsylvania County, VA ************************************************************************ Your record request #26-25 has been submitted successfully. This office is in receipt of your request for records made in accordance with the Virginia Freedom of Information Act (§ 2.2-3700 et seq.). Your request will be forwarded to the appropriate staff for review and response. As the requester, you can always see the status of your request by signing into the Pittsylvania County, VA portal. If you haven't already signed in, you may need to activate or setup your account to get started. Once your account is activated, you can communicate directly with the Pittsylvania County, VA through NextRequest. ************************************************************************ Reply to this email or sign in to contact Pittsylvania County, VA.

Change your email settings | Visit our help center

communications.subject: Records Request MuckRock Sinyangwe, Samuel
communications.communication:
Hello:

Below is the process on how to submit a records request.

Note:  The records you are wanting to request are CCJRA as opposed to CORA. Pursuant to the CCJRA, C.R.S. Sec.24-72-301, et seq, records will go through the process of review as it is applicable to the record(s) being requested.

You will need to submit the official records request form.  You can find our form on the Pueblo County Sheriff’s Office website.  Little less than halfway down are circles.  It is the records request.  In the first paragraph is the PDF form you will need.   Please fill out completely included exactly what you are requesting.
It will need to be mailed in to the address listed on the form or brought into our main office at 909 Court St. Please add ATTN: Records.
It needs to be dated and signed.
Copy of ID for verification.
We do need a deposit payment as we charge $30/hr for search/retrieval.  Your initial deposit will be $90 your request will not be placed into queue until we receive payment. Payment must be cash, check, or money order, we are unable to accept card.

The request will then go through the process of review.

Depending on the way the data was stored will determine how we respond.

Thank you.

Lucas Lopez-Villegas
Records CJRT
lucas.lopez-villegas@pueblocounty.us<mailto:lucas.lopez-villegas@pueblocounty.us>
Office: 719-583-6459
Fax:  719-583-4945
[cid:image001.jpg@01DC905A.6200D3B0]
Pueblo County
Sheriff's Office
909 Court Street
Pueblo, CO 81003
Main: 719-583-6125

This e-mail message, including any attachments, is for the sole use of the intended recipient(s) and may contain confidential, privileged and protected information. Any unauthorized review, use, disclosure, or distribution is prohibited. If you are not the intended recipient, please contact the sender by reply e-mail, and destroy all copies of the original message and attachments.  Thank you.

communications.subject: Santa Rosa County Sheriff's Office - Public Records Request PRR-2026-345: Confirmation
communications.communication:
Dear Requester, 
  
 You have submitted a Public Records Request to Santa Rosa County Sheriff's Office, which has been accepted.  
  
 In accordance with §119.07(c), F.S., the custodian of public records for the Santa Rosa County Sheriff's Office acknowledges your request to inspect or copy records.  You will receive a follow up email when your request has been completed.  
  
 To track your request, please visit: https://url4102.request.justfoia.com/ls/click?upn=u001.nrfdmL-2B1UhWpB4V2ArB2sZloaUg7IbAXdgtc0f-2FLnatSzIrGRwDIJO5SUna3cx8kdeNvAgIp2DUlkJvz0m1C7Q-3D-3Dsa3r_7q7yKhfs8ZYzr1ovgAl1KQUzX1ObRFLwuLX-2BIYtbeOnE5l6sgR56c5k2m5iE9PNIFzG4rP3rPpfmQbetEz8AG2Ir3X0t4DeEEvazqZXbmmUDRYdolDO9emJRuQ03wvukbRv0KSHwig2IU1QWeuHP4fXEIMNCAGauAIMciwri7SbIrH7J1znUV18i3uFC5Dkc5Gnw-2Bu5NWhVjipV9nKL0qvO-2F3tfYG-2BsDUIB9o8xpi198jCCgkP2mse3mj34phtlpy7SugjQv3eA5wzOAjuHxOd3waJy3FDvrfEbEH-2BWM2Ctbl9uTSkBTPmYVUZ1gPtYe 
  
 Your request reference number is PRR-2026-345 and your security key is 14FE806D. 
  
 Please have this security key and reference number available when communicating with our staff regarding your request. 
  
 Your request is now in progress.  All requests are processed in the order in which they are received and in a reasonable amount of time.  Please be aware all records must be reviewed to determine if the records contain exempt and/or confidential and exempt information that cannot be released in accordance with Florida's public records laws.  Some requests are labor intensive and may take longer than requests for other record types which may affect fulfillment times.  
  
 Thank you, 
  
 Santa Rosa County Sheriff's Office
5755 East Milton Road
Milton, FL 32583
(850) 983-1268
records@srso.net 
  
 ________________________________________________________________________________________________________
 
 Powered by

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Florida Sunshine Law, I hereby request the following records:

Use of force (UOF) data dating from January 1, 2017 to December 31, 2025.
